charges.charge_description: 18:371.F CONSPIRACY TO DEFRAUD THE UNITED STATES On or about and between September 22, l998 the defts did knowingly and intentionally conspire to steal, purloin and knowingly convert to their own use, and, without authority, sell, convey and dispose of a thing of value of the United States, to wit: approximately 2,935 tons of cemetery bank run, which bank run had a value exceeding $100, in viol ation of section 641 of Title 18. (1)

18:641.F PUBLIC MONEY, PROPERTY OR RECORDS On or about and between September 22, l993 the defts did knowingly and intentionally steal, purloin and knowingly convert to their own use, and, without authority, sell convey and dispose of a thing of value of the United Sates to wit approximately, 2,935 tons of bank run located at the Cemetery, whcih ban run had a value exceeding $100. (2-7)

18:1341.F FRAUDS AND SWINDLES On or about and between ll/l9/93 the defts did knowingly and intentionally devised and intended to devise a scheme and artifice to defraud and for obtaining money and property by means of false and fraudulent pretenses, representations and promises, and, for the purpose of executing such scheme and artifice and attempting to do so, caused to be delivered by the postal service mail matters and things according to the directions thereon (8-9)

18:1001.F STATEMENTS OR ENTRIES GENERALLY On or about October 26, l995 the deft. in a matter within the jurisdiction of the executive branch of the Government of the United States, to wit: the Department of Veterans Affairs, did knowingly and willfully make a materially false, fictitious and fraudulent statement and representation when he stated to a Special Agent of the Department of Veterans Affairs that the Cemetery needed a hole dug in the dump area and that, in exchange for the bank run excavated and removed, top soil was delivered at a ratio of one load of top soil for every three loads of bank run, even though, as he then and there well knew and believed, the Cemetery did not need work performed and had not entered into a barter agreement. (10)

18:371.F CONSPIRACY TO DEFRAUD THE UNITED STATES On or about and between September 22, l998 the defts did knowingly and intentionally conspire to steal, purloin and knowingly convert to their own use, and, without authority, sell, convey and dispose of a thing of value of the United States, to wit: approximately 2,935 tons of cemetery bank run, which bank run had a value exceeding $100, in viol ation of section 641 of Title 18. (1)

18:641.F PUBLIC MONEY, PROPERTY OR RECORDS On or about and between September 22, l993 the defts did knowingly and intentionally steal, purloin and knowingly convert to their own use, and, without authority, sell convey and dispose of a thing of value of the United Sates to wit approximately, 2,935 tons of bank run located at the Cemetery, whcih ban run had a value exceeding $100. (2-7)

18:1341.F FRAUDS AND SWINDLES On or about and between ll/l9/93 the defts did knowingly and intentionally devised and intended to devise a scheme and artifice to defraud and for obtaining money and property by means of false and fraudulent pretenses, representations and promises, and, for the purpose of executing such scheme and artifice and attempting to do so, caused to be delivered by the postal service mail matters and things according to the directions thereon (8-9)

18:1503.F INFLUENCE/INJURING OFFICER/JUROR/WITNESS On or about April 17, l996 the deft., in response to a Federal Grand Jury subpoena served on Custom Clay requesting copies of, among other things,"all truck lease or truck rental records reflecting date, time quantity of material and cost of truck,"did knowingly and intentionally and corruptly endeavor to influence, obstruct, and impede the due administration of justice by asking an employee of AA Trucking, whose identity is known to the grand jury, to produce a false document. (11)
